goals__remit: the Union of Romanian Inland Ports has been established in 2006 by port administrations and port operators from romanian ports along the Danube. The main goals are integration of romanian ports into logistic chains at international level and development of passenger traffic on Danube. To reach these goals tje union perform activities to  develop port business, to uptake inovation in port activties, to improve cooperation between port comunity stakeholders, to improve port labour competences and to improve social dialog
relevant_communication:
Extension of the General Block Exemption Regulation to Inland Ports - contributions 
Revision of TEN-T - contribution in concultancy process 
Platform for multimodality and logistics in inland ports set up by DG MOVE - member 
DABS project : assesment of freight flows in Black Sea Basin and connection to Danube ports 
PORTIUS - Port Labour Study (contribution) 
Rhin Danube corridor study (memeber of group of expetrs) 
TRAINING4PORTS project : assesment of labour market in Lower Danube ports (Romania, Ukraina and REpublic of Moldova)
